oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter written by William Henry Bendy, Co. M, 9th N.J. Inf. Regt., USA to his parents, sisters and friends
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Bendy's regiment took part in the attack on Roanoke Island in February 1862 and spent most of the war in the North Carolina coast, except for a few months at Petersburg in 1864. In this letter he relates, "Tom and I was at Newbern (sic) the other day and I had my picture taken and I just came of (sic) picket-and you must execuse the ugly looks for it is not taken good" He asks that his mother send him a photograph as he misses her. He asks that they save him some chestnuts and hickory nuts.
